title: Newsround presenters celebrate show turning 50
description: John Craven, Lizo Mzimba and Julie Etchingham are among presenters recalling their time on the show.

title: Pet cloning is getting more popular despite the cost
description: The controversial process of cloning your dog or cat is growing more popular, despite its high cost.

title: The Ukrainian mother who had to bury her own son
description: Iryna Kostenko tells the BBC's Jeremy Bowen how Russian soldiers killed her 27-year-old son and took over her home.

title: Rogue pastors, fake miracles and murder
description: Across Africa, extreme Christianity is threatening the faith of many.

title: Ukraine war: The women sharing their memories of Ukraine before the war
description: Four women who shared viral videos of Ukraine before the war speak to the BBC about those memories.

title: Newsround at 50: Five memorable moments as Newsround celebrates anniversary
description: BBC children's show Newsround celebrates five decades of bulletins.

title: The Papers: 'Horror in Bucha' and Russia 'worse than Isis'
description: The alleged killings of Ukrainian civilians by Russian soldiers dominates Monday's front pages.

title: Match of the Day 2: How Tottenham's Harry Kane 'ran riot' against Newcastle
description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Nedum Onuoha and Ian Wright explain how Harry Kane "ran riot" as Tottenham thrashed Newcastle 5-1 in the Premier League.

title: Tottenham 5-1 Newcastle: Has Harry Kane been given a dilemma by Antonio Conte's side?
description: Tottenham are rejuvenated under Antonio Conte and moved into the top four, leaving Harry Kane a dilemma about whether to stay or go at the end of the season.

title: Ukraine round-up: Widespread condemnation over killings in Bucha
description: The discovery of bodies scattered along a street in a Ukrainian town has sparked horror.

title: Sacramento shooting: At least six dead in centre of California state capital
description: At least six people are killed and nine injured in a shooting in California's state capital.

title: Rangers 1-2 Celtic: League leaders come back to increase gap to six points
description: Celtic take a giant stride towards reclaiming the Scottish Premiership title after battling back to beat Rangers at Ibrox and move six points clear of their rivals.

title: Tory MP David Warburton suspended amid sexual harassment allegations
description: Party sources say three allegations of sexual harassment against David Warburton are being investigated.

title: Energy rationing not part of UK approach, minister says
description: Grant Shapps says the policy is "not a route we want to go down" despite pressure on supplies.

title: Shrewsbury maternity scandal: Calls for independent oversight of services
description: Catastrophic failings in Shropshire's maternity services contributed to hundreds of babies' deaths.

title: Pakistan heads for early election amid move to remove PM Imran Khan
description: Imran Khan says the US is leading a conspiracy to remove him because of foreign policy decisions.

title: Sunflower oil: UK bottler has a few weeks' supply left
description: Makers of oven chips, crisps, ready meals and cereal bars are racing to find alternatives.

title: Just Stop Oil: Dozens arrested after protests at Kingsbury oil terminal
description: Protests at several sites around the Midlands and south of England enter a third day.

title: Prince Andrew returned from Falklands War 'a changed man', he says in deleted post
description: The prince recalled his Falklands War experience in a now deleted post on his ex-wife’s Instagram.

title: Zelensky spokesman describes heartbreaking scenes in Ukraine
description: A spokesman for Ukraine's President Zelensky describes the discovery of mass graves.

title: Women's World Cup final: Alyssa Healy leads Australia to glory over England
description: Watch highlights as Alyssa Healy's 170-run innings helps Australia outclass England to win the Women's World Cup final in Christchurch, New Zealand.

title: Search resumes for plane missing over the Channel
description: The aircraft was carrying two people and vanished after taking off from Wellesbourne, Warwickshire.

title: Twins and their mother blinded in bombing have sight restored
description: The mother of five-year-old twin boys describes how she tried to protect as their house was bombed.

title: Women's World Cup final: England's Shrubsole caught by Gardner to seal win for Australia
description: England's Anya Shrubsole is caught by Ashleigh Gardner to seal victory for Australia in the Women's World Cup final in Christchurch, New Zealand.

title: Women's World Cup final: Australia outclass England to take title
description: Australia underline their status as the premier international sports team on the planet by outclassing England to win the Women's World Cup.

title: Smoke rising in Ukrainian port city Odesa after strikes
description: Smoke is seen after explosions are heard in the strategic southern port city of Odesa on the Black Sea coast.

title: The Papers: Tory MP suspended and Baby P case
description: Sunday's papers focus on a Conservative MP having the whip removed and the parole of Baby P's mother.

title: Women's World Cup final: Watch the best of Healy's century against England
description: Watch the best shots from Alyssa Healy's brilliant 170 from 138 balls against England in the Women's World Cup final in Christchurch, New Zealand.

title: Ukraine war: Bucha street littered with burned-out tanks and corpses
description: A BBC team witnesses utter devastation in the town of Bucha, after Russian soldiers pulled out.

title: The ‘real outlier’ in the crossword puzzle-making community
description: Anna Shechtman is determined to make the crossword puzzle scene more diverse, but has also had to deal with her own anorexia.

title: Four-day week: What we do with our extra day off
description: Employees say they feel liberated to enjoy quality leisure and family time.

title: Ethiopia's Tigray war: Inside Mekelle cut off from the world
description: A resident of conflict-hit Tigray gives a rare insight into life there after 17 months of war.
